body:
Comment 3: 
The _default_ with Mountain Lion is to require that apps either come from the App Store
or be signed with a code-signing key which has a cert issued by Apple, as part of the
developer program.

The OP is using the OS defaults.

Basically, the new default is like "always sign your releases with PGP so folks can
trust what they download", but with the signing bundled as part of the app and having to
use an x509 key with Apple as the trusted CA for code-signing.  As long as Apple remain
open to developers getting keys cheaply, it's not too bad and does at least provide some
protection against trojanning of code.
